meanings.definition: To engrave or carve into a surface.
meanings.sent1: She carefully insculped her initials on the tree trunk.
meanings.sent2: The artist insculped intricate patterns on the stone tablet.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous squirrel insculped a heart on the freshly poured cement.
meanings.sent4: His words were insculped in her memory forever.
meanings.sent5: The ancient hieroglyphics insculped on the temple walls told stories of the past.

meanings.definition: To impress or stamp a design onto a surface.
meanings.sent1: The jeweler insculped the family crest on the silver ring.
meanings.sent2: The coin was insculped with the image of a majestic eagle.
meanings.sent3: The playful puppy insculped paw prints in the wet sand.
meanings.sent4: Her kindness was insculped in the hearts of all who knew her.
meanings.sent5: The logo was insculped on the packaging, making it instantly recognizable.
